subject: Re: [junit] Disabling Inherited Tests
msgSnippet: Thanks JB.  It s excellent advice.  David also suggested it and it s running beautifully. Thanks again, - Ole
messageBody:
Thanks JB. It's excellent advice. David also suggested it and it's running beautifully.

Thanks again,
- Ole

J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>
>
> Ole Ersoy wrote:
> >
> >
> > Hi,
> >
> > I've created
> > a SetupTest class
> > that just performs setup,
> > but also tests the setup.
> >
> > So when other test
> > classes inherit from it,
> > the inherited tests run
> > each time.
> >
> > Anyone know if I can disable the inherited tests?
>
> You can't. I suggest pulling the setup code one more superclass higher,
> making that superclass abstract, then adding one subclass that contains
> the setup tests.
